result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon Jamel Turner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court orders defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge, if not already done.  Pay costs, assessments and surcharges at the rate of $50 per month commencing 9-15-14 if a payment is more than 10 days late, a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

Commencing 6-11-14.Huber for work and school. Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance or alcohol forfeits the release privileges. Credit 4 days time served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon Jamel Turner

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brandon Jamel Turner not in court.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DEFENDANT IS DECEASED.
ANY FINE/FORFEITURES, COSTS, ASSESSMENTS AND SURCHARGES TO BE WAIVED.
ANY OUTSTANDING CIVIL JUDGMENTS, FINE & COST COMMITMENTS, SUSPENSIONS FOR DRIVING PRIVILEGES TO BE VACATED AND/OR WITHDRAWN.

Sentencing proceeds.  Statements by counsel and defendant.

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 90 days at the House of Correction commencing 6-11-14 with Huber for work and school and 4 days credit; pay costs, assessments and surcharges at the rate of $50 per month commencing 9-15-14 if a payment is more than 10 days late, a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

COURT ORDERS:
- defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge, if not already done.

Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance or alcohol forfeits the release privileges. 

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement received and filed.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to the amended charge and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Amended  Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Defendant Brandon Jamel Turner in court with attorney Louis E Epps.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Amended Information received and filed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of a copy of the Amended Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty.  Court accepts the Amended Information and AMENDS the charge to Possession of Tetrahydrocannabinols 961.41(3g)(e) an unclassified misdemeanor.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds
State's Witness List, State's Requested Jury Instructions and Jury Instructions received and filed./ds

Defendant Brandon Jamel Turner in court with attorney Louis E Epps.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defense moves to withdraw the motion.  Court grants motion to withdraw the motion.  State has provided defense with additional.  Defense would like 10 days in case the discovery gives rise to additional motions.  Pretrial scheduling order received and filed.  Attorney Epps has a jury trial set on 6-9-14 in Br. 15.  Court will set this case as a backup jury trial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 9, 2014 at 09:00 am.
State's Response to Motion to Supress received and filed./ds

Defendant Brandon Jamel Turner in court with attorney Louis E Epps.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

NO FILE IN COURT.    Court finds the defendant is in violation of monitoring.  State is not asking for any change in bail at this time.  Case remains set for 5-8-14 for motions.
Original Transcript (13 pages) commencing 3-21-2014 PRELIMINARY HEARING & ARRAIGNMENT received and filed.

Defendant Brandon Jamel Turner in court with attorney Louis E. Epps.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defense is asking for DNA testing be completed on the pill bottle.  Court will not order it at this time.  Court finds no basis to have the bottle tested.  Motions to be filed by 4-16-14; response/reply by 5-2-14.  Motion hearing scheduled for May 8, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant Brandon Jamel Turner in court with attorney Louis E. Epps.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Christopher Conway-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 44.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 3/20/14.
css

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Brandon Jamel Turner in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Brandon Jamel Turner in custody.  Lucy J. Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge KONKOL, Branch 44.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
